Getting Started with qctools

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette takes the user through the basic functionality of the qctools package. The user will gain experience with:

  • creating and updating a QC log
  • generating simple visual diffs to use during QC

Setup

Load libraries 

library(qctools)

Create demo repo

demoRepo() creates a temporary Git repo containing files with version history. This repo already contains a QC log and partially completed QC for demonstration purposes. The function returns the path to the repo.

repo <- demoRepo()
print(repo)
## [1] "/tmp/Rtmp0dRja2/qctools-demo-2f527671b35b"

Using the QC log

If a repo does not contain a QC log, the first step would be to run logCreate(), which will generate an empty one. As mentioned above, the demo repo already contains a QC log. The contents are shown below.

##                     file                                   commit reviewer
## 1 script/data-assembly.R                       Initial-Assignment   anyone
## 2  script/pk/load-spec.R                       Initial-Assignment   anyone
## 3    script/combine-da.R                       Initial-Assignment   anyone
## 4   script/examp-txt.txt                       Initial-Assignment   anyone
## 5 script/data-assembly.R ed1983203b82081896925f9acc89f2cf3b2e247c michaelm
## 6  script/pk/load-spec.R ed1983203b82081896925f9acc89f2cf3b2e247c michaelm
## 7    script/combine-da.R ed1983203b82081896925f9acc89f2cf3b2e247c michaelm
## 8 script/examp-yaml.yaml ed1983203b82081896925f9acc89f2cf3b2e247c michaelm
## 9    script/combine-da.R fd2a2d29f03fbc9cbba3b99cb78bdbe4e8479e7e michaelm
##                  datetime
## 1 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 2 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 3 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 4 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 5 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 6 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 7 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 8 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 9 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT

A few helpful definitions:

  • file: Relative file path from the location of the QC log.
  • commit: Commit hash of last modification to the file.
  • reviewer: Reviewer of the file, given as the equivalent in R to Sys.info()[["user"]].
  • datetime: Time of the assignment or acceptance.

logAssign

When a file is ready for QC, it should be assigned in the QC log. This can be done using the logAssign() function, which will add a record to the QC log.

Looking at the demo QC log, the first row is an example of a record that logAssign() will generate.

##                     file             commit reviewer                datetime
## 1 script/data-assembly.R Initial-Assignment   anyone 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT

Notice that commit is set to Initial-Assignment since the file has only been added to the QC log and not actually QCed. Additionally, the reviewer is set to “anyone”.

If we want to assign another file, such as script/examp-yaml.yaml, we can do the following:

logAssign("script/examp-yaml.yaml")

logAccept

After the reviewer completes their QC of a file, logAccept() should be used to create a record of this. The commit at the time of QC is captured along with the username of the reviewer.

We can look at the QC history of script/data-assembly.R to demonstrate the differences between logAssign() and logAccept().

##                     file                                   commit reviewer
## 1 script/data-assembly.R                       Initial-Assignment   anyone
## 5 script/data-assembly.R ed1983203b82081896925f9acc89f2cf3b2e247c michaelm
##                  datetime
## 1 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT
## 5 2024-06-05 19:03:24 GMT

Notice that the row created by logAccept() updated the commit value to the commit hash of the most recent modification to the file when it was QCed. The reviewer was updated from “anyone” to the actual user who did the QC.

logPending

logPending() is a helpful function for identifying files in need of QC. It will return all files that meet the following criteria:

  • assigned with logAssign() but no completed QC
  • modifications made since the last QC was done

Running logPending() on the demo repo will result with the following output:

##                     file last_author reviewer                datetime
## 2 script/data-assembly.R    michaelm michaelm 2024-06-05 19:03:30 GMT
## 3   script/examp-txt.txt    michaelm   anyone 2024-06-05 19:03:29 GMT
## 4 script/examp-yaml.yaml    michaelm michaelm 2024-06-05 19:03:30 GMT
## 5  script/pk/load-spec.R    michaelm michaelm 2024-06-05 19:03:30 GMT

Every row returned indicates a file in need of QC. Along with the relative path of the file, the author and most recent reviewer of the file is provided. If the reviewer is marked as “anyone” then the file has never been QCed before.

Helpful tools for QCing

When logPending() indicates a file is in need of QC but has previously had a QC completed at an earlier revision, it is helpful to know what changed. This can save QC efforts where only a minor change was made.

diffQced() helps with this as it generates a visual diff in the Viewer pane in RStudio. All deleted, added and modified lines of code are shown in the diff.

When diffQced() is supplied a file name, it uses the QC log to identify the commit when the last QC was completed. The difference is then generated using the version of the file at that commit versus the current file.

diffQced("script/data-assembly.R")

QC Summary

logSummary() outputs all files in the QC log along with their QC status.

The QC status of a given file could be one of the following:

  • Assigned, needs QC: file has been assigned in the QC log, but never has been QCed
  • Modified, needs QC: file has been QCed previously, but has had modifications since
  • Fully QCed: file has no QC needs currently.

To see an example of a QC summary document, run the following locally:

logSummary()
##                     file              status
## 1    script/combine-da.R          Fully QCed
## 2 script/data-assembly.R Modified - needs QC
## 3   script/examp-txt.txt Assigned - needs QC
## 4 script/examp-yaml.yaml Modified - needs QC
## 5  script/pk/load-spec.R Modified - needs QC
